alert.note: Alert for Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pickens County through 500 PM CDT... At 409 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Columbus to 6 miles north of Gordo. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aliceville, Gordo, Reform, Carrollton, Pickensville, Ethelsville, Memphis, McMullen, Garden, Benevola, Johnston Lake, Bevill Lock And Dam, Gainesville Lake Campground, Dillburg, North Pickens Airport, McShan, George Downer Airport, Owens, Kirk and Pioneer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Alabama.
